a.g: By the sky and the night comer -
And what can make you know what is the night comer?
There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
So let man observe from what he was created.
He was created from a fluid, ejected,
Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
Indeed, Allah, to return him [to life], is Able.
The Day when secrets will be put on trial,
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Mysteries of Purity
Indeed, this matter will be unveiled **[yawma tubla as-sara'ir]** on the day when the secrets [as-sara'ir] are tested, and the day when what is in the graves is scattered and what is in the breasts [as-sudur] is attained. At that time, the pure ingot [as-sabikah] will be distinguished from the tinsel [al-bahrajah]. So we seek refuge in Allah from disgrace on the day of the greatest presentation [al-'ard al-akbar].

a.g: Then man will have no power or any helper.
And [by] the earth which cracks open,
Indeed, the Qur'an is a decisive statement,
Indeed, they are planning a plan,
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Self-Delusion
Indeed, God the Exalted has warned of His guile [makr] and His gradual enticement [istidraj], saying: "So none feels secure from the plan of God except the people who are losers." And He the Exalted said: "And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "And they planned, and God planned. And God is the best of planners." And He the Exalted said: "Indeed, they are planning a plan, and I am planning a plan. So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile." Therefore, just as it is not permissible for the heedless servant [al-'abd al-muhmal] to infer from the master's neglect of him and enabling him with blessings that this indicates the master's love for himâ€”rather, he should fear that this is guile [makr] and a plot [kaid] from him, even though the master did not warn him of his own guileâ€”then how much more incumbent is this regarding God the Exalted, along with His warning of His gradual enticement [istidraj]? It is more fitting. Thus, whoever feels secure from the guile [makr] of God is deluded [maghá¹­Å«r]. The origin of this delusion [ghurÅ«r] is that he inferred from the blessings of the world [al-dunyÄ] that he is held in honor [karÄ«m] with that Bestower. Yet it is possible that this is evidence of degradation [hawÄn]. But that possibility does not agree with the lower self [al-hawÄ]. So Satan, by means of the lower self [al-hawÄ], inclines the heart [al-qalb] towards what accords with it, which is believing its indication of honor [karÄmah]. And this is the definition of delusion [ghurÅ«r].

a.g: But I am planning a plan.
So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.
